_description: A macaronic Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Alleluya Alleluya deo patri sit gloria’

BodAsh189.First Lines:
Saluator mundi domineFader of heuene yblessyd þou
                    be…
BodAsh189.Last Lines:
…Ioy & & [sic] blysse A mong vs beFor att thys tyme
                    borne ys he
BodAsh189.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 54-5; 1977, 45-6.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 117.
Oliver,  Raymond. 
             Poems Without Names: The English Lyric 1200-1500.
         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 20.

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Saluator mundi dominefader of hevyn blessyd þou
                    be…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…Worshepe þat chyld so frede virgine
                    maria
BodEngPoete1.Note: Four stanzas only, with De virgine maria refrain.

Saluator mundi domineFader of heuene blyssid þu
                    be…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…Blyssid mot þey alle beDeo patri sit
                    gloria
